properties.evidence: This study explores the efficacy of Achillea millefolium L. (A. millefolium) extract, known for its phytoestrogenic properties, in treating OC through hormonal and metabolic modulation.
This study explores the efficacy of Achillea millefolium L. (A. millefolium) extract, known for its phytoestrogenic properties, in treating OC through hormonal and metabolic modulation.

Conventionally, BC is recognized as a hormone-dependent cancer, and the estrogen-progesterone and their correlated receptors as estrogen receptor and progesterone receptor (ER and PR, which are called the hormone receptor [HR]) signals play a key role in pathogenesis and progression of BC by controlling the cellular programs and promoting cell proliferation, survival and final dissemination as metastases.
In fact, hormone-related BC (HR-positive BC [HR + BC]) is the most common subtype of BC, regardless whether human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) is present or not,
